characters.description: Gatsby is eager to impress Daisy and displays a mix of nervousness and joy during their reunion. He shows off his wealth and possessions, seeking her approval and revaluing everything based on her reaction.

Daisy is reunited with Gatsby after many years and is overwhelmed by his wealth and the beauty of his shirts. She is initially embarrassed but later expresses joy and admiration for Gatsby's possessions.
Nick observes the interactions between Gatsby and Daisy, acting as a facilitator for their reunion. He is initially uncomfortable with the situation but tries to make them feel at ease.
Tom is only mentioned when Daisy is told not to bring him.
The Finn is Nick's domestic help, who is present during the tea preparation and is scrutinized by Gatsby.
Gatsby's gardener is sent to cut Nick's grass in preparation for Daisy's visit.
Ferdie is Daisy's chauffeur, who is instructed to leave for an hour.
Wolfshiem is mentioned in the context of Gatsby's side business, which he offers to Nick.
Mr. Klipspringer, the 'boarder,' is seen doing liver exercises in one of Gatsby's rooms.
Mr. Dan Cody is an elderly man in a yachting costume in a photograph, identified as Gatsby's best friend who is now dead.
A maid is seen opening the upper windows of Gatsby's house and spitting into the garden.
